alert.note: Alert for Northern Warren; Northern Washington (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 26 at 7:29PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Warren and northern Washington Counties through 815 PM EDT... At 727 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Bolton Landing, or 7 miles northeast of Warrensburg, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Warrensburg, Whitehall, Comstock, Bolton Landing, Huletts Landing, Mount Hope, Bolton, Hampton, Shelving Rock, Cleverdale, South Bay, Middle Granville, North Granville, South Bay Village, Truthville, Raceville, Sabbath Day Point, Grays Corner, West Granville and East Whitehall. This includes Interstate 87 between exits 23 and 24. Rainfall of a half an inch to an inch may occur in an hour. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized poor drainafe flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
